\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}
\subsubsection*{template$<$typename FBMcoeff = int$>$\newline
class Persistent\+Laplacians\+::\+Filtered\+\_\+\+Boundary\+\_\+\+Matrix$<$ FBMcoeff $>$}

Class for storing, manipulating, and retrieving the boundary matrix at different filtration levels

{\footnotesize\ttfamily template$<$typename FBMcoeff  = int$>$ \\
int \mbox{\hyperlink{classPersistentLaplacians_1_1Filtered__Boundary__Matrix}{Persistent\+Laplacians\+::\+Filtered\+\_\+\+Boundary\+\_\+\+Matrix}}$<$ FBMcoeff $>$\+::index\+\_\+of\+\_\+filtration (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{bool}]{use\+\_\+domain\+\_\+filtrations,  }\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{typedefs_8hpp_afc86493f3736a9d186d249149b2e5e22}{filtration\+\_\+type}}}]{a }\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}}

Get the largest index where the corresponding filtration value is not more than a. If there are multiple simplices with the same filtration highest value, it will return the largest index. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em use\+\_\+domain\+\_\+filtrations} & if true, iterate over the domain filtrations (n-\/simplices), if false over the range filtrations (n-\/1)-\/simplices \\
\hline
{\em a} & filtration value ~\newline
 \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
The largest index where the corresponding filtration value is not more than a. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
